ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY

Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: response to naming question on trial1  : which is Sally? Which is Anne?
Notes: EXAMINER: This Sally and this is Anne. SCORING: 0 = Incorrect; 1 = Correct

ElementDescription: response to Belief Question on trial1 : where will sally look for her marble?
Notes: EXAMINER: Sally first placed a marble into her basket. Then she left and the marble was moved, by Anne, into her hidden box. Then Sally returned. SCORING: 0 = Incorrect; 1 = Correct

ElementDescription: response to Reality Question in trial1: where is the marble really?
response to Memory question in trial1: where was the marble in the beginning?
response to Naming Question in trial2 : which his sally? Which is anne?
Notes: EXAMINER: This Sally and this is Anne. SCORING: 0 = Incorrect; 1 = Correct

ElementDescription: response to Belief Question in trial2: where will sally look for her marble?
Notes: EXAMINER: Sally placed a marble into her basket. Then Sally left and Anne gave the marble to me. Then Sally returned. SCORING: 0 = Incorrect; 1 = Correct
